name: Revideo
headline: Create Videos with Code
description: We are building tools for programmatic video creation. Revideo, our open-source framework, lets you create video templates in Typescript and render them via an API. It also provides a React player component to display changes in the browser in real-time.

founders.name: Konstantin Hohr, Founder
founders.description: Konstantin is the founder of Revideo. Previously, he studied computer science at RWTH Aachen while simultaneously working as a software engineer at Jodel, where he built content moderation and abuse detection systems. At DynamoAI (W22), he spearheaded development on vertical federated learning based products.

[![GitHub](https://re.video/_next/static/media/github.b95ffe36.svg)](https://re.video/<https:/github.com/redotvideo/revideo>)[![Discord](https://re.video/_next/static/media/discord.d40e5cf8.svg)](https://re.video/<https:/discord.gg/MVJsrqjy3j>)[Login](https://re.video/</login>)

We are fully open source and MIT licensed.
[Star2.0k](https://re.video/<https:/github.com/redotvideo/revideo>)
Video infrastructure for developers.
Revideo is an open-source framework for programmatic video editing based on Motion Canvas. You can use it to automate complex video workflows, or to build entire video editors in the browser.
npm init @revideo@latest
[Github](https://re.video/<https:/github.com/redotvideo/revideo>)[Platform Waitlist](https://re.video/<https:/tally.so/r/mOz4GK>)
Backed by
Combinator
Build tools to create videos at scale.
Use Revideo to build complex apps. Preview instantly and render to MP4 when you're done. This is how it works.
1.
Create a template.
Build a template for the video you want to create using Typescript.
```
exportdefaultmakeScene2D(function*(view){
```
```
// Get text from the scene variables
```
```
const variableText =useScene().variables.get('text','');
```
```
// Add a text element
```
```
const textRef =createRef<Txt>();
```
```
	view.add(
```
```
<Txt ref={textRef} text={variableText()} fill="#FFFFFF" fontSize={80} fontFamily={"Roboto"}/>,
```
```
);
```
```
// Let text pulsate
```
```
yield*textRef().fontSize(100,1);
```
```
yield*textRef().fontSize(80,1);
```
```
});
```

2.
Pass in your data.
Pass in your data to the template to create a video. Data can be anything. Text, images, videos or complex data structures.
text:
3.
Preview instantly.
Preview the video in your browser. Changes to the data are reflected instantly which allows for real-time applications.
0:00 / -1:-1
4.
Render your video.
Render your video to an MP4 programmatically and use it anywhere.
Render video!
Need Inspiration?
Check our templates to see what you can build with Revideo.
Short-Form Content Automation
Write code to fully automate your content with various AI tools.
npm init @revideo --youtube-shorts
[View Code](https://re.video/<https:/github.com/redotvideo/examples/tree/main/youtube-shorts>)
Drag-and-Drop Editor
Use Revideo to easily build a video editor with drag-and-drop functionality in NextJS.
npm init @revideo --minimal-drag-drop
[View Code](https://re.video/<https:/github.com/redotvideo/examples/tree/main/minimal-drag-drop>)
Video A/B Testing
Programmatically create hundreds of different video variations to optimize for engagement
npm init @revideo --marketing-templates
[View Code](https://re.video/<https:/github.com/redotvideo/examples/tree/main/marketing-templates>)
Github Star Visualization Website
Build apps that generate videos with dynamic content by integrating with external APIs like Github.
npm init @revideo --saas-template
[View Code](https://re.video/<https:/github.com/redotvideo/examples/tree/main/saas-template>)
Code Explainer Videos
Write code to create beautiful code animations and explainer videos.
npm init @revideo --rive-explanation-video
[View Code](https://re.video/<https:/github.com/redotvideo/examples/tree/main/rive-explanation-video>)
Parallelized Rendering on AWS Lambda
Deploy your rendering pipeline across parallelized AWS Lambda functions for super fast speeds.
npm init @revideo --parallelized-aws-lambda
[View Code](https://re.video/<https:/github.com/redotvideo/examples/tree/main/parallelized-aws-lambda>)
Join the community
Join our Discord to get help, share your projects and get updates on new features.
Next steps
Getting started

[Give us a star on Github](https://re.video/<https:/github.com/redotvideo/revideo>)
[Check out the docs to get started](https://re.video/<https:/docs.re.video>)
Project of the week

Make your own RPG style adventures from a prompt. Infinite Stories, Infinite Characters, Infinite Locations.
[Visit their website](https://re.video/<https:/storiesbyangris.com/>)
Want to be featured here? Show us your project on Discord!

generated_description:
### Revideo: Creating Videos with Code

**Overview**  
Founded in 2023 and located in Berlin, Germany, Revideo is a fresh player in the developer tools space, particularly focused on programmatic video creation. The company is part of Y Combinator's Batch S23 and is driven by a mission to enable developers to create videos through code with ease.

**Mission**  
The core mission of Revideo revolves around the idea of "Create Videos with Code." They aim to simplify the video creation process by allowing developers to build video templates using Typescript and render videos with an accessible API.

**What They Offer**  
Revideo provides an open-source framework that serves as a powerful tool for programmatic video editing. Users can automate complex video workflows or even build entire video editors that operate right in the browser. By utilizing Motion Canvas, Revideo fosters an environment where developers can:

1. **Create Video Templates:** Craft templates in Typescript that can define the structure and elements of the videos.
2. **Pass in Data Effortlessly:** Input various forms of data—be it text, images, or advanced data structures—to populate the templates.
3. **Preview in Real-time:** Changes can be instantly seen in the browser, aiding developers in quick iterations.
4. **Render Videos Programmatically:** Finally, rendered videos can be exported to MP4 format for wider usage.

**Current Projects and Features**  
Revideo is all about practicality and innovation in video creation. They provide starter templates for:

- **Short-Form Content Automation:** Perfect for automating social media content.
- **Drag-and-Drop Editors:** Build intuitive video editing interfaces using NextJS.
- **Video A/B Testing:** Create numerous video variations to maximize engagement.
- **Dynamic Content Generation:** Integrate with APIs to build contextual video content.
- **Code Explainer Videos:** A novel way to visualize coding processes through animation.

Additionally, they support parallelized rendering capabilities, which can leverage AWS Lambda for faster processing.

**Community and Support**  
Revideo invites developers to join their community on Discord where members can get assistance, share projects, and stay updated with new features. They also emphasize the importance of collaboration and contributions in an open-source setting.

**Getting Started**  
If you’re a developer looking to ease the burden of video creation, check out their comprehensive [documentation](https://re.video/docs.re.video) or visit their [GitHub](https://github.com/redotvideo/revideo) to explore the code. They encourage participation, so don't hesitate to star the project or share your experiences in their community.

Revideo is not just another tool; it's a platform that empowers creators to leverage code in the dynamic world of video. By bridging the gap between development and multimedia, they’re paving the way for the next generation of content creation.
